definition: surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt

sentences.english: A bazaar was held for the poor.
I was invited to a bring-and-buy sale yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我应邀去了一个义卖会。

sentences.english: Hold a Thanksgiving charity bake sale.
sentences.chinese: 开展感恩节糕饼义卖慈善活动。

sentences.english: This year The Gift Bazaar 2011 will be held at the Canadian International School, Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 礼物义卖会将在加拿大国际学校举办。

sentences.english: Betty and Bob brought back blue balloons from the big bazaar.
sentences.chinese: 贝蒂和鲍勃在大型的义卖市场买了蓝汽球回来。

sentences.english: They decided to take up a collection and hold a bake sale.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定举办一次烘烤食品义卖进行募捐。

sentences.english: The church is getting up a sale to collect money for the homeless children.
sentences.chinese: 教堂正在筹划一次义卖，为无家可归的孩子筹款。

sentences.english: The fete will go ahead provided the rain keeps off.
sentences.chinese: 要是不下雨，义卖会就照常进行。

sentences.english: The fete will take place on Sunday, rain or shine.
sentences.chinese: 游园义卖会定于星期日举行，风雨无阻。

sentences.english: Today, at the charity shop where I volunteer, a woman started yelling at me because a mirror on sale was 'dirty'.
sentences.chinese: 慈善义卖商店，这种商店销售的一般都是二手物品。

sentences.english: They rummaged out some old clothes for the jumble sale.
sentences.chinese: 他们翻找出了一些旧衣服去做义卖。

sentences.english: We bundled up some old clothes for the jumble sale.
sentences.chinese: 我们把一些旧衣物捆起来准备义卖。

sentences.english: Our church held a fair to raise money for charity.
sentences.chinese: 我们教堂举办了一次义卖会为慈善事业筹款。

definition: to donate goods (to a relief effort)/to contribute material
compassion/kindness/care for others/love/CL:片[pian4]/charity (bazaar, golf day etc)/heart (the symbol ♥)
to donate money/to contribute funds/donation/contribution (of money)
